summary: Profile/personal website to be created based on the user's resume.

existing_features.title: Add a resume data intake flow so the site can be built from the user's resume content: provide a clear UI prompt/instructions asking the user to paste their resume text (or provide structured fields), and generate/populate all page sections from that content in English.

Implement a responsive, single-page profile website layout with standard resume-driven sections: Hero (name + title + short summary), About, Experience, Education, Skills, Projects, and Contact; include a top navigation that scrolls to sections and works well on mobile.

Add basic SEO and share metadata and a polished footer: set page title, meta description, and Open Graph/Twitter card tags using the resume-derived name/title/summary when available; add a footer with location (if in resume), email (if in resume), and social links (if in resume).

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme for the profile site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and enforce it consistently across all sections; avoid a blue/purple default palette.

Add the generated image assets to the frontend static assets and render them in the UI: use the hero background image in the Hero section and use the profile illustration/avatar image in the Hero/About area.
Extend the profile data model to support an optional user-provided profile photo, stored client-side, so the photo persists across reloads along with the rest of the profile.
Add a profile photo upload control to the existing profile editing flow (the Resume Intake dialog) to let the user choose an image file from their device, preview it, and optionally remove/clear it.
Render the user-uploaded profile photo on the site as the avatar image when present; otherwise fall back to the existing generated illustration asset.
